title: Adelaide Festival boss Rob Brookman to retire in 2020
text:
ADELAIDE Festival executive director Rob Brookman will retire after next year’s event in February-March, at the end of his current contract.

Mr Brookman, 65, had originally planned to retire when he finished a similar role with State Theatre Company three years ago, but returned to run the Festival in a part-time capacity.

During his 45-year career in the arts, Mr Brookman led the Adelaide Festival Centre, was artistic director of the 1992 Festival and co-founded Womadelaide, for which he remained an adviser for 15 years.

As general manager of Sydney Theatre Company for a decade from 1999, he oversaw the appointment of Cate Blanchett and her husband Andrew Upton as its artistic directors.

“It has been a singular privilege to spend 20 of the last 45 years engaged in the task of helping make our Festival one of the best in the world,’ Mr Brookman said.

The Festival board has begun recruitment and plans to appoint a new executive director early next year.
